channel.title: Summit on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Summit on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Summit 2024: Building bonds our way
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The journey begins Penang’s vibrant streets became our playground this year. Our goal stood clear and simple: reconnect, recharge, and create memories together.

item.title: 43 Factory WALA: Lessons from coffee craftsmanship for software engineering
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At first thought, visiting a coffee shop for WALA might sound a bit strange. But 43 Factory has all the characteristics we love: The place is run by young, passionate, talented people; coffee craftsmanship is the goal, providing value customers is top priority; lean business model.

item.title: DZS Media WALA: Lessons from film production for software engineering
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The tech world has much to gain by learning from other industries. Techies always look for unconventional ways to seek insights and learnings.

item.title: Echelon X Singapore 2024: Where Innovations Meet Inspiration
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This year’s Echelon X in Singapore was a bustling hub of innovation, bringing together around 10,000 participants, including 154 speakers, 50 TOP100 startups, investors, corporates, and government agencies from over 35 countries.

item.title: SP Group WALA: Insights on digital transformation and partnership in energy sector
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’ve always wanted to visit SP Group, one of our partners, but the pandemic made it impossible until now. This year, the opportunity finally came when we decided to attend Echelon X in Singapore.

item.title: Summit 2022: Engineering A Good Time
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We don’t treat team bonding the common way because we understand our engineers. Most of our engineers don’t want to run and get sweaty on the beach for “team-building” activities, or pretend to smile in front of the travel agent’s camera.
